**Clarent** is an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") sword in GreyKnight's [Clarent Patch](http://nhpatchdb.alt.org/?278). The "other" sword from Arthurian legend (after [Excalibur](/wiki/Excalibur "Excalibur")), Clarent is a proposed replacement for Excalibur as the lawful [crowning](/wiki/Crowning "Crowning") gift, given that Excalibur can already be created easily by #dipping a [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword") into any [fountain](/wiki/Fountain "Fountain").

When [invoked](/wiki/Invoke "Invoke"), Clarent reveals the location of all [pets](/wiki/Pet "Pet") on the level and increases the [tameness](/wiki/Tameness "Tameness") of those within line of sight.

Versions of Clarent have been incorporated into the variants [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM").

In dNetHack, [Clarent](/wiki/DNetHack_Artifacts#Clarent "DNetHack Artifacts") is a lawful [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword"), the crowning gift for [Knights](/wiki/Knight "Knight"). It has a +2+1d12 to-hit and +1d20 damage bonus versus [thick-skinned](/wiki/Thick-skinned "Thick-skinned") creatures. It also has +2 to-hit bonus versus [phasing](/wiki/Phasing "Phasing") creatures. When wielded by a Knight, Clarent does not resist being [held second](/wiki/Twoweapon "Twoweapon") to other [artifact weapons](/wiki/DNetHack_Artifacts "DNetHack Artifacts").

Clarent can be used as a [digging tool](/wiki/Digging "Digging").

## SlashTHEM

In SlashTHEM, Clarent's base item class is [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword"), as in the patch. It is the first [sacrifice gift](/wiki/Sacrifice_gift "Sacrifice gift") for [Knights](/wiki/Knight "Knight") and has a fixed +8 to-hit and +2 damage bonus versus [thick-skinned](/wiki/Thick-skinned "Thick-skinned") creatures. In addition, it functions as a [luckstone](/wiki/Luckstone "Luckstone") while carried.

SlashTHEM inherits [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM")'s lack of restrictions on [dual-wielding](/wiki/Twoweapon#SLASH.27EM "Twoweapon") artifacts, so Clarent can be held second to another [artifact weapon](/wiki/SlashTHEM_artifacts "SlashTHEM artifacts") by any [role](/wiki/Role "Role").

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Clarent](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clarent "wikipedia:Clarent")***

Clarent appears in the medieval poem *Alliterative Morte Arthure* alongside Caliburn (i.e. Excalibur) as a sword associated with [King Arthur](/wiki/King_Arthur "King Arthur"). In popular culture it is often identified with the sword that Arthur pulled from the stone, while Excalibur is identified with the sword Arthur received from the Lady of the Lake.

In the Clarent Patch, when Clarent is given to a crowned player, it appears embedded in a nearby wall, door, or tree, in a reference to the sword's mythos. It can be retrieved using the #untrap command, if the player is [devoutly](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record") lawful. Its function as a [digging tool](/wiki/Digging "Digging") also references the legend.

## Encyclopedia entry

Clarent is the sword which Arthur drew forth from the stone,  
proving himself a rightful king. It represents authority  
and leadership. Clarent cleaves through stone easily, but  
only those dedicated to law can remove it from a stony  
grasp.
